title: Frederick Hawkins
text: Frederick Joseph Hawkins (died 2 August 1956) was an Irish politician. He was an <a href="Independent%20politicians%20in%20Ireland">independent</a> member of <a href="Seanad%20%C3%89ireann">Seanad Éireann</a> from 1938 to 1944, and 1946 to 1956. He was first elected to the <a href="2nd%20Seanad">2nd Seanad</a> in April 1938 by the <a href="Labour%20Panel">Labour Panel</a>. He was re-elected in August 1938 and 1943 again by the Labour Panel but lost his seat at the 1944 Seanad election. He was re-elected to Seanad at a <a href="by-election">by-election</a> on 24 July 1946, replacing <a href="John%20Thomas%20Keane">John Thomas Keane</a>. He was re-elected at the 1948, 1951 and 1954 Seanad elections. He died in office in 1956. No by-election was held to fill his seat.
